intro: Isocarpha billbergiana, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It features slender, erect stems and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant adaptations.
